title: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl.
Beat butter and sugars until creamy. Add eggs and vanilla.
Gradually blend in flour mixture. Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake 9-11 minutes until golden brown. Cool on baking sheet.

title: Simple Pasta Aglio e Olio
steps: Cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cook until garlic is golden (1-2 minutes).
Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup pasta water.
Add pasta to the pan with garlic oil, toss to combine.
Add pasta water if needed. Season with salt, pepper, and parsley.
Serve with grated Parmesan if desired.

title: Fresh Garden Salad
steps: Wash and dry all vegetables thoroughly.
Combine mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion in a large bowl.
Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper for dressing.
Drizzle dressing over salad and toss gently.
Top with crumbled feta cheese.
Serve immediately.

title: Shahi Paneer
steps: Step 1: Prepare the Base
Heat 2 tbsp oil or ghee in a pan.
Add:
1 bay leaf
2–3 cardamoms
3–4 cloves
1 small cinnamon stick
Add 1 chopped onion, 1–2 green chillies, 6–7 garlic cloves, 1-inch ginger.
Sauté until onions turn light golden.
Step 2: Add Tomatoes & Cashews
Add 2 chopped tomatoes.
Add 10–12 cashews.
Cook for 5–6 minutes until tomatoes turn soft.
Cool the mixture and blend it to a smooth paste (add a little water if needed).
Step 3: Cook the Gravy
In the same pan, heat 1 tbsp butter.
Add the blended paste.
Add dry spices:
½ tsp turmeric
1 tsp red chilli powder
1 tsp coriander powder
Salt to taste
Cook for 4–5 minutes till oil separates.
Step 4: Make it Shahi
Add ½ to 1 cup water to adjust gravy consistency.
Add 3–4 tbsp fresh cream.
Add ½ tsp kasuri methi (crush with hand).
Cook for 2–3 minutes on low flame.
Step 5: Add Paneer
Add 200–250g paneer cubes.
Mix gently and cook for 2 minutes on low flame (don’t overcook paneer).
Step 6: Final Touch
Sprinkle ½ tsp garam masala.
Garnish with fresh coriander.
Serve hot with naan, roti, or jeera rice.
